items.title: Is it time to rethink mobile-first CSS?
items.content:
#â€‹548 â€” June 29, 2022 | Read on the web

Defensive CSS â€” A new site full of handy, practical CSS and design tips (covering things like media queries, selectors, fallbacks, etc) to help in building future-proof user interfaces. Thereâ€™s also an introductory blog post outlining â€œwhy itâ€™s important to design and write CSSÂ defensivelyâ€.

Ahmad Shadeed

W3C to Become a Public-Interest Non-Profit Organization â€” The World Wide Web Consortium, founded by Tim Berners-Lee himself, has been the main standards organization for the Web since 1994, and is set to become a US non-profit inÂ 2023.

Coralie Mercier (W3C)

Test Your Web App for Accessibility â€” Free axe DevTools Chrome browser extension for dev teams. Start testing in just minutes and join 200,000+ active weekly users in squashing accessibility bugs. Build a more accessible and inclusive web app today with axeÂ DevTools.

Deque sponsor

Mobile-First CSS: Is It Time for a Rethink? â€” Is so called "mobile-first" CSS always the best option in 2022? Patrick explores the pros and cons of the classic methodology, as well as when other solutions might workÂ better.

Patrick Clancey

â–¶Â Â Is Sass Still Relevant? â€” Vitaly Friedman talks to Stephanie Eckles about whether Sass is still relevant in 2022 and if it adds any value to modern CSS workflows. ~30 minutes. TranscriptÂ available. In related news, Adam Laki asks why use Sass?

Smashing Magazine podcast

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • Version 102 of Firefox is out now. Here's the changes that affect devs. In related news, Thunderbird 102, basically the e-mail client yin to Firefox's browser yang, has also been released.

  • Can I Devtools? It's like Can I Use and Can I Email, but for the browser devtools we all rely on.

  • It may surprise you as to how Apple makes those striking 3D effects as you scroll. Steve Sewell shares a video looking at how it's done (his account is well worth a follow BTW).

  • Curious as to how image compression works (JPEG in particular)? â–¶ï¸ This video digs into the detail with particularly high production values.

  • The JavaScript specification has a new (more permissive) license.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Getting the Right Space Around Headings in Web Typography â€” A typographic dive into the spacing around headings, font sizes, etc. Some nice before and after sliders here to visualize the differences, plus a 17 minute video review of a real-worldÂ site.

Oliver SchÃ¶ndorfer

Style Queries Explained â€” 'Style queries' join 'container queries' in the new contain-level-3 spec. They let you query the style of any parent element within a page and apply styles to its children based on the styles of its parent. Hereâ€™s anÂ explainer.

Una Kravets

The Future of Frontend Build Tools â€” The nature of frontend build tools like WebPack, Snowpack or Vite is shifting. They are moving towards being built in lower level languages like Rust to improve the speed and performance while also adding â€œunbundled developmentâ€ using ES modules to improve the local developmentÂ experience.

Alexander Joseph

GV (Google Ventures) Invests $35M into Notification Infrastructure API â€” Scalable and reliable no-code UI has parity with a robust API that lets you deliver to your users their preferredÂ experience.

Courier.com sponsor

Voice Control Usability Considerations For Partially Visually Hidden Link Names â€” Partially visually hidden link names may be good for people who use screen readers, but they can be problematic for those who rely on voice controlÂ software.

Eric Bailey

A Modern React, MDX + MJML HTML Email Workflow â€” We know better than most that creating HTML layouts that work in email clients is hard work, but this is a neat exploration of a modern approach leveraging React, Mailjetâ€™s MJML framework, and MDX - a way to work with Markdown inÂ JSX.

Josh W Comeau

Faster Page Loads Using 'Server Think-Time' with Early Hints â€” Here's how your server can send hints across to the browser (Chrome 103) about criticalÂ sub-resources.

Kenji Baheux (Chrome Developers)

'My Dumbest CSS Mistakes' â€” When writing code, we all make mistakes. The author shares some of the most common CSS ones they find themselvesÂ correcting.

Geoff Graham

Build Internal Tools in Minutes with Retool, Where Visual Programming Meets the Power of Real Code

Retool sponsor

A CLS Punishment for Progressive Enhancement? â€” Andy stumbled across an issue with Lighthouse in which a bad performance score was returned for a progressive enhanced burger menu pattern. It didnâ€™t take long for folks to offer someÂ suggestions/solutions.

Andy Bell

'Apple Is Not Defending Browser Engine Choice'
Alex Russell opinion

Jobs

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools & Resources

Bunny Fonts: A Privacy-Friendly Google Fonts Alternative â€” These are open-source fonts designed to be a drop-in replacement for Google Fonts, they use the same API format and help projects stay fullyÂ GDPR-compliant.

BunnyWay

UI Buttons: 100 Modern CSS Buttons in Every Style You Can Imagine â€” Definitely some unique button styles here, all of which you can try live here.

UI Haven

Blob Animation: Generate An SVG-Based Smooth Blob Animation â€” Includes lots of options to customize the â€˜blobâ€™ including animation speed and ability to add a background image to the shape, after which you can download as SVG or copy the inlineÂ code.

Aldison Lluka

LetsMarkdown: An Open Source Collaborative Markdown Editor â€” Features a VS Code-like live collaborative markdown editor with preview, minimap, dark mode, and no loginÂ required.

Wensen Wu

âœ¨ QUICK RELEASES

D3.js 7.5 â€“ The popular data visualization framework.
bootstrap-fileinput 5.5 â€“ File upload control and previews for Bootstrap users.
Simple Icons 7.3 â€“ SVG icons for popular brands.
TailPress 3.1 â€“ Boilerplate Wordpress theme using Tailwind CSS.
flag-icons 6.6.2 â€“ A curated collection of all country flags in SVG.
Playwright 1.23 â€“ Browser automation library and test runner.
